fields.description:
Currently no upper size limit has been set in Confluence for specifying *Attachment Maximum Size*. This allows users to set the limit to a large number that could exceed the [JVM limit|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12509], leading to problems during indexing.
Please put an upper limit on this parameter to avoid such issues.
fields.summary: Set an upper limit for attachment size

fields.description:
A lot of our user gets the message "You must enter a title" after editing and saving a page. It happens on different pages and only sometimes after saving a page. If the problem happens they can only solve it by closing the browser window. We are using the NTLM filter for single sign on. They all are using IE 6.0.2900.2180.xpsp_sp2 on Windows XP. 

It is not the same Problem like in CONF-9317 because in the System is no Scaffolding Plugin installed

The steps to the bug:

-Open an existing page 
-Hit the edit tab
-Edit the page content
-Press the save button
-The system reloads the page after that the title is erased and the "You must enter a title" message appears
fields.summary: If you save a page after editing the system lost the title and displays: "You must enter a title"
Include global statistics plugin as supported plugin
Page transclusion with variable substitution

fields.description:
Email notifications of wiki page changes show the entire page and not the delta.

Please allow users to configure email notifications to show deltas instead of the entire page. Your RSS feed builder already allows this.
fields.summary: Allow email notificaitons to show deltas

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12493].
  {panel}

I have created a table to help sort customers by names and deliveries.

It happens that some of my customers are companies that use acronyms, hence the use of capital letters.

Example:  AXXX, Abcd, Azzz will be sorted in that order rather than Abcd, AXXX, Azzz or Azzz, AXXX, Abcd

Confluence sorts first the customers in all capital letters then then others.

I tried to find a solution to this issue, but didn't find any.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Sorting tables when some names are acronyms (capital letters)
Provide a macroId to uniquely identify multiple instances of a macro on a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12480].
  {panel}

JNDI resources bound to the "env/comp" namespace are only visible to web container managed threads. Theads spawned by a web application (such as those that are used by the Quartz scheduler) are unable to find any resource bound in such a context and will fail with a {{NameNotFound}} exception.

This is problematic when such a job may cause the initialization of a lazy-init spring bean that requires a resource from that namespace.

We might need to do some reseach into either:

a) developing a mechanism whereby this lookup will succeed (unlikely I think)
b) Making sure that such a situation can be caught earlier.
fields.summary: Support access to JNDI resources from non container threads

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12469].
  {panel}

At the moment a user encounters an error message like this:

---
CONFLUENCE
System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies! Please contact your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file (if possible). 

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you! 
---

It would be great if an email could be sent with the complete error message to a pre defined e-mail address.
But it could be even better if automatically a new Jira issue could be created with the complete error message, without needing user input.

This way the system administrator will be notified about every error happening in the system with a full error log without the need to dig up all system log files searching for errors.

It could be usefull for Atlassian too if an Atlassian email address could be added to send the error messages so you will know what goes wrong 
with your products.
fields.summary: Auto Confluence error mail ingestion

fields.description:
Currently, MySQL 4.x appears in our list of "not supported by will probably work" databases here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/List+Of+Supported+Databases

In Confluence 3.0, we'll be improving the performance of some of our database queries using nested queries. These queries won't work with MySQL 4.0 because it doesn't support subqueries. However, it is likely that MySQL 4.1 will continue to work despite still being unsupported.

Could you please note in the 2.10 release notes that changes are planned for Confluence 3.0 which will prevent it working with MySQL 4.0? We should recommend that customers using this database upgrade to MySQL 5.
fields.summary: Document that MySQL 4 will no longer work with Confluence 3.0

fields.description:
A customer has offered some suggestions regarding the installation procedure. Verify the procedure, determine if any documentation changes are required, then update the installation guide as necessary.

{quote}
I have couple of comments on the install process that may be of value for updating your documentation? I've noted the steps I took in case you wish to try and recreate the issue.

1. Problem installing for the first time - from instructions located: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+Standalone+on+Windows+from+Zip+File. Running XP SP2 & IE6.

- Setting the java environment variable required a reboot for me (XP, SP2) before it took affect. The documentation should recommend a reboot perhaps? (Clean java install, jdk-6u7-windows-i586-p-iftw.exe. Instructions from: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+the+JAVA_HOME+Variable+in+Windows)

- No errors I could see in Tomcat from startup.bat. Ran http://localhost:8080/ and the license registration failed which I assume was because I hadn't rebooted. I got a screen full of errors but sorry did not save them.

- Closed and restarted confluence and re ran http://localhost:8080/. On restarting, it had moved past the license registration screen and on to configuration. But, when I got through to the dashboard it had no themes / styles i.e. just text. Nothing on the documentation I could find.

- I deleted the \data area, moved it & the param referring to it and rebooted. This restarted the license and config process from scratch. Ran through fine, no errors and dashboard is perfect. Problem solved. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Verify installation instructions as requested by customer

** Steps To Reproduce:
1) create and save a private jira filter (e.g. assignee = paul chambers, resolution = unresolved)
2) give it a custom column order, remove one or more columns (e.g. assignee, resolution)
3) use {jiraissues} macro to insert it into confluence page

** Expected Result:

Appearance of filter output in confluence approximates appearance in jira, including custom sort order, column order

** Actual Result:

Confluence honors the sort order of the jira filter, but not the column order (and hiding of columns).

** Additional Information (Setup/Notes/etc):

{jiraissues} macro does provide a 'column' parameter to control visibility and order of columns. So there is a workaround.

But as stated, you would expect that specifying a certain filter in the plug-in would include its appearance, not just its query.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro should display column order like in the original filter

fields.description:
The {{ConfluenceCachingCaptchaStore}} class has no explicit cache configuration in the {{confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml}} meaning that it will by default use a replicated cache.

It seems that our current version of jcaptcha has a bug which can mean deserialization fails  in certain circumstances and by using a distributed cache we can fall victim to this defect. See http://forge.octo.com/jcaptcha/jira/browse/FWK-80

We can avoid this problem by not using a distributed cache, but also there is probably no need to be caching captcha's across all nodes in the cluster. With session affinity the captcha doesn't need to be cached beyond the node it was generated on.

We should probably just add something like -
{noformat}
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.confluence.cache.jcaptcha.ConfluenceCachingCaptchaStore</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>local:default</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
{noformat}

This is raised from the support case https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-20815
fields.summary: Don't use distrbuted cache for storing Captcha's in a cluster

fields.description:
The documentation on the Excerpt macro says that it "does not change the display of a page", the sole purpose in being to invisibly mark a piece of text for display elsewhere in another page. However, as of version 2.5.7 (or perhaps a little earlier) and later, the rendering changed so that the excerpted text is wrapped in

tags in the HTML rendering. This breaks a lot of my pages' layouts. Example: This page provides the details on {excerpt}how RotoMan manages your XRLP data {excerpt} using your LDAP account. This used to render all on one line in HTML in the source wiki page. But now, it renders like this:

This page provides the details on

how RotoMan manages your XRLP data

using your LDAP account.

which is not only visually wrong, it even violates HTML syntax rules. Please revert to the old rendering of {excerpt} in which *no* HTML markup was produced. Or at the very least, there should be an option in the excerpt tag to turn off the

tags.
fields.summary: Excerpt macro inserts undesireable line breaks (paragraph tags) in HTML rendering

fields.description:
When you set the Global Logo for Confluence and then start creating new spaces, the image for each space is broken.  For example...

When you set the main global logo, it puts the file in *../../confluence-data/resources/mylogo.gif.*  But when you create a space, say, FOO it sets that space to also have the custom logo (which is fine).  But when you pull up the home page for the new space, the image is broken in IE (and doesn't show in FF) and in the logs, I see *FileNotFoundExceptions* since its looking for *../../confluence-data/resources/FOO/mylogo.gif. *

{code}

fields.description:
When you open up a page to edit in the Wiki Markup editor in IE 6.0, it comes up fine.  But once you type something in the body, the text area seems to jump to the right, underneath the Help Tips section.   It can be corrected by resizing the window.  Minor issue, wanted to note it.

See attached screenshots for examples. See main text area expanded further to the right in the low right corner of the 2nd screenshot (jumped).
fields.summary: Wiki Markup editor expands in IE when typed in

fields.description:
A long time ago when I wrote our authenticator for wikis.sun.com, I noticed that under some circumstances our SSO server didn't redirect back to wikis.sun.com correctly. It redirected to a confluence URI without specifying the host and the domain, which resulted in the browser ending up on our SSO server instead of wikis.sun.com server.

I wrote a patch for this issue, which we have been using in production for over a year now. Since the patch fixes an issue in Confluence that affects others, I'd like it to be absorbed into the main source base, instead of me maintaining it.

There are actually two patches:
- {{seraph--original-absolute-url.patch}} - patches Seraph
- {{confluence--login-redirect-fix.patch}} - patches Confluence and depends on the Seraph patch
fields.summary: Confluence breaks SSO integration (PATCH)
Add info about nolink to the notation guide

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12415].
  {panel}

Hyperlinked page titles in 2.8 and above are confusing and are messing up colour schemes. 

The confusion issue is the one already covered in [CONF-5795] for the last item in the breadcrumb trail. Users don't expect links to take them back to where they started!

The colour scheme issue is that now page titles are links, they take the global/space link colour. The only way to get the page titles to fit with a custom colour scheme is to change all global/space link colours so they're the same as the Heading text - but this makes it difficult to spot links at a glance...

Suggestions:

* Unlink page titles  (or give users an option to unlink)
* Add an option to the global/space colour scheme to set Page Title colours independently of links.
fields.summary: Unlink page titles in 2.8 and above (or at least provide option for customising page title colour)

Tried opening the links in a separate tab, and the feature does work. Seems like it's an issue with some kind of ajax call not being sent properly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12411]. {panel} The html used for rendering icon links is currently pretty ugly. Semantically incorrect and presents one of many Confluence violations of 508 compliance. In addition to that the use of {{nobr}} class causes many issues (broken design) when content contains links that should wrap on a new line, but can't because of this class. See [CONF-12207|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12207] and attached screen shot. The patch attached to this JIRA represents modifications to atlassian-renderer needed to get rid of the ugly html and replace it with much cleaner CSS implementation of the same feature, which in addition to generating prettier code also allows links to wrap correctly when they are too long. I'm attaching screenshots of various links before and after the patch to show that the result looks the same, but links wrap correctly. Here is the difference in the html code: h4. before: {code:html}

foo
new link with title
new link
foo@foo.com
attachment


looong ling that wraaaaaaaaaaaapsss on to a new line after it reeeeeaches the end of this line

{code} h4. after: {code:html}

foo
new link with title
new link
foo@foo.com
attachment


looong ling that wraaaaaaaaaaaapsss on to a new line after it reeeeeaches the end of this line

{code} It might be even possible to drop the use of {{icon-position-\*}} classes and define the image position directly in {{icon-name-\*}} classes. I wasn't sure which css file was the best place to stick the code in, so I picked {{master.css}}, which looked the best for this code.
fields.summary: Improve html used to render links (PATCH)

fields.description:
When Confluence 2.9 goes onto CAC, the Pagetree macro will include an optional search box. The Pagetreesearch macro will still work, but that plugin will eventually be deprecated.

We should change the left-hand nav bars in *all* documentation spaces to use Pagetree plus optional search box, rather than Pagetreesearch.

Do this in the DOC space, and all other documentation spaces.
fields.summary: Replace search box in the left-hand nav bars in all documentation spaces

fields.description:
I noticed that on several installs, Confluence by default displays its full version number and sometimes build number to the world.

It is a commonly accepted web security practice to withhold all product details, including version information, except to users on a "need to know" basis. Otherwise, you provide hackers key information they can use to attack your systems.

It is also a commonly accepted web security practice for applications to be secure in their default configuration.

Please have Confluence's default configuration respect best practices and withhold all product details except to product administrators or those authorized by the administrators.
fields.summary: Restrict the transmission of Confluence version details

When uploading new versions of a Office 2007 Spreadsheet the previous version will be returned from the "current" file link.  You have to upload the file twice to actually see your changes reflected in the version.

# Make a change to the .xlsx file and upload it again to create a new version with the same filename
# Open the most current version and it will still be the old version.  
* You have to upload it again and then click on the previous version and you will finally see the changes.  

Very frustrating.  I thought It just creates copies of the file and renames the old ones for backup.
fields.summary: XLSX Office 2007 documents do NOT version correctly

fields.description:
Do not reload and parse static xwork configuration every time an xwork module changes state

Everytime an xwork plugin module is enabled or disabled we trigger a reload of the entire xwork configuration. We should at least cache the static configuration defined in {{xwork.xml}} so that we don't have to reload and reparse it everytime. This impacts Confluence start up time when many xwork modules are loaded.
fields.summary: Improve startup time by not reloading complete xwork configuration when plugin state changes

Profile pictures aren't being antialiased when resized, resulting in really bad quality images.

See the two attachments I am going to upload as an example. The guy's original picture looks fine, but the version resized by Confluence is so bad it makes him look like he has milk all over his lip.
fields.summary: Add antialiasing to profile picture resize

Using remote API returns the following command in the html "$dateFormatter.format($page.lastModificationDate)" rather than the value as seen in Dashboard import.

Please see attached screen shots.
fields.summary: Exporting a Space in HTML format using Remote API does not return the page timestamp.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12383].
{panel}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use Confluence Server and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and are working with a third party Accessibility compliance vendor to perform an Accessibility review of the product and issue an updated VPAT 2.2 certificate. This is on track to be published by February 2019. 

 

Regards,

Peter Scobie

Program Manager, Server

-----

Make Confluence Section 508 accessibility standard compliant.

[http://www.section508.gov/]

Indicative of the requirements are in the Voluntary Product Accessibility Template (VPAT) for Web-based Internet information and applications:

(a) A text equivalent for every non-text element shall be provided (e.g., via "alt", "longdesc", or in element content). 
 (b) Equivalent alternatives for any multimedia presentation shall be synchronized with the presentation. 
 (c) Web pages shall be designed so that all information conveyed with color is also available without color, for example from context or markup. 
 (d) Documents shall be organized so they are readable without requiring an associated style sheet. 
 (e) Redundant text links shall be provided for each active region of a server-side image map. 
 (f) Client-side image maps shall be provided instead of server-side image maps except where the regions cannot be defined with an available geometric shape. 
 (g) Row and column headers shall be identified for data tables. 
 (h) Markup shall be used to associate data cells and header cells for data tables that have two or more logical levels of row or column headers. 
 (i) Frames shall be titled with text that facilitates frame identification and navigation 
 (j) Pages shall be designed to avoid causing the screen to flicker with a frequency greater than 2 Hz and lower than 55 Hz. 
 (k) A text-only page, with equivalent information or functionality, shall be provided to make a web site comply with the provisions of this part, when compliance cannot be accomplished in any other way. The content of the text-only page shall be updated whenever the primary page changes. 
 (l) When pages utilize scripting languages to display content, or to create interface elements, the information provided by the script shall be identified with functional text that can be read by Assistive Technology. 
 (m) When a web page requires that an applet, plug-in or other application be present on the client system to interpret page content, the page must provide a link to a plug-in or applet that complies with §1194.21(a) through (l). 
 (n) When electronic forms are designed to be completed on-line, the form shall allow people using Assistive Technology to access the information, field elements, and functionality required for completion and submission of the form, including all directions and cues. 
 (o) A method shall be provided that permits users to skip repetitive navigation links.

Jira has a request here: [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5574]
fields.summary: Section 508 Compliance for Confluence (VPAT)

fields.summary: The browse menu (people directory) is shown even when a user is not logged in
Reduce line-height of title so wrapping doesn't look so ugly

fields.description:
PLUG-73 is causing problems reinstalling plugins.

During development you often want to install SNAPSHOTS of a plugin before releasing it.  This can mean installing updates of a plugin that all have the same version.  PLUG-73 is meant to force confluence to uninstall before reinstalling the plugin.

It appears that some resources may still be cached and aren't being flushed correctly during the uninstall.  This results in stale templates being used.

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-73
fields.summary: Plugin Loader should reinstall plugin if same Version is installed

fields.description:
Currently it is possible to define CSS files and its content headers in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}} descriptor. What is not possible is setting media type for these files.

This prevents theme and plugin developers from taking full advantage of the new way Confluence handles printing (as of 2.8). Mainly, if a plugin output should not be visible in the printable output, achieving this without hacking the theme templates is not possible.

It would be great if an additional property was supported in the descriptor, something like:

{code}
<resource type="download" name="style.css" location="com/example/plugin/style.css">
   <property key="content-type" value="text/css"/>
   <property key="css-media" value="print"/>
</resource>
{code}
fields.summary: Add support for specifying css media for plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12373].
  {panel}

As Confluence grow in size (eg. a few thousand of global spaces), inserting a link when editing a page will become slow (up to 10 seconds). 

This is because the pull down menu includes a listing of all the available global spaces.

Confluence site search (ie. dosearchsite.action) will also be affected as the spaces are listed the same way as when inserting a link.

A work around is to comment out the control block in *<confluence-install folder>/includes/common-space-select-box.vm* and comment out the code section that calls for Global spaces to be listed:
{code}
#*
    #if ($availableSpaces.size() > 0)
    <optgroup label="$action.getText('global.spaces')">
        #foreach ($option in $availableSpaces)
            <option value="$option.key" #if( $searchQuery.spaceKey == $option.key ) selected#end>$webwork.htmlEncode($option.value)</option>
        #end
    </optgroup>
    #end
*#
{code}

Similarly to disable Global Space listing in confluence search, modify *<confluence-install folder>/template/custom/space-select.vm*:
{code}
#*
    #if ($availableGlobalSpaces.size() > 0)
    <optgroup label="$action.getText('global.spaces')">
        #foreach ($option in $availableGlobalSpaces)
            <option value="$option.key" #if( $value == $option.key ) selected#end>$webwork.htmlEncode($option.value)</option>
        #end
    </optgroup>
    #end
*#
{code}
fields.summary: Slow link creation when there are numerous global spaces are involved - might also affect Confluence search

fields.description: If you create a space with the key 'tracker' then the space is displayed completely unstyled - as though the CSS is never being sent.  It appears that 'tracker' is a reserved word that interferes with confluence.
fields.summary: Using space key 'tracker' prevents any CSS being applied to the theme
Long text in a column is cut off in firefox when browsing in a small screen resolution (eg.1024x768)

fields.description:
This is an edge case of CONF-8805

Wiki markup allows users to embed images into their pages that Confluence cannot actually see.
If a page containing such an image is edited in the wysiwyg editor, then the size of the image is changed to 32 by 32 pixels.
This happens because the PlaceholderImageRenderer, which is used in this case of a missing image, is hardcoding that incorrect size.
fields.summary: Image width and height are to 32 by wysiwyg editor for missing image files.

fields.description:
The [Working with Macros|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Macros] documentation page needs updating and correcting. Some things I've noticed:

 - The Spacegraph macro and Flowchart macros aren't installed by default, and in fact depend on the Graphviz plugin.
 - The Userlister macro doesn't exist (it is listed in the plugin repository as "Outdated" since 2.4).
fields.summary: List of bundled macros needs reviewing

fields.description:
It appears there have been instances of connection pool leaks in C3P0 0.9.0.4, according to this issue in Hibernate:

http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-2032

We should upgrade to 0.9.1 or later to fix this. (Apparently the c3p0 case number is 00010976, but I can't find that anywhere.)

The message in the logs looks like this:

14:43:58,253 WARN BasicResourcePool:1222 - com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$AcquireTask@edf4c8 -- Acquisition Attempt Failed!!! Clearing pending acquires. While trying to acquire a needed new resource, we failed to succeed more than the maximum number of allowed acquisition attempts (30).

The upgrade should be backwards-compatible, so the c3p0 JAR can be dropped into Confluence 2.7.x instances as well to fix this problem.
fields.summary: Upgrade c3p0 to 0.9.1 or higher to avoid Acquisition Attempt Failed error

fields.description:
Our 500page.jsp is something users see fairly often unfortunately, yet its styles seem to have been lost during 2.9 development.

We should fix this up, and also fix the doctype to use the standards-compliant one.
fields.summary: Improve 500 error page formatting and markup
